section.title: Install Options
section.para: JBoss Developer Studio can be installed in a number of different ways.
You can install JBoss Developer Studio, packaged with Eclipse and dependent third-party plug-ins, with a universal installer for all operating systems.
Alternatively, if you already have Eclipse on your system you may prefer to install JBoss Developer Studio BYOE. This option installs JBoss Developer Studio in Eclipse.

section.title: Install JBoss Developer Studio
section.para: A universal installer .jar file is provided for installing JBoss Developer Studio and it is available from the Customer Service Portal.

Alternatively, the source code is also available as a .zip file at the same location. You can use this source code to build the universal installer yourself and then use that to install JBoss Developer Studio. Maven must be installed to build the universal installer from the source code.
Both options are detailed in the procedure below.

step.para: Log in to the Customer Portal at https://access.redhat.com.
From the menu bar click Downloads.
Under Red Hat JBoss Middleware, click Download Software.

figure.title: Download Red Hat JBoss Middleware Software on the Customer Portal

textobject.phrase: Log in to the Customer Portal at https://access.redhat.com. From the menu bar click Downloads. Under Red Hat JBoss Middleware, click Download Software.

step.para:
Under Software Downloads, select the following options:
From the Product list, select JBoss Developer Studio.
From the Version list, select 7.0.x.

figure.title: JBoss Developer Studio Downloads Listed on the Customer Portal

textobject.phrase: Under Software Downloads, select the following options: From the Product list, select JBoss Developer Studio. From the Version list, select 7.0.x.

step.para: Complete the appropriate step for your chosen install option:

For installing from the provided universal installer, from the table click Download for the Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio 7.0.x Stand Alone Universal Binary download file. This downloads the universal installer .jar file.
For installing from a source-built universal installer, follow these steps:
From the table, click Download for the Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio 7.0.x Source Code download file. This downloads the sources .zip file.

On the command line, navigate to path/to/.zip and enter unzip jbdevstudio-product-sources-7.0.x.build_version.zip where x.build_version is substituted to match the name of the downloaded file. The archive is extracted to a devstudio directory.

To build the universal installer, on the command line navigate to devstudio/product and enter mvn clean install Building takes some time to complete, after which the universal installer .jar file is located in installer/target/.

On the command line, navigate to path/to/.jar and enter java -jar jbdevstudio-product-universal-7.0.x.build_version.jar where x.build_version is substituted to match the name of the .jar file.
To start the installer, you may be able to double-click the .jar file.
When the Installer window opens, click Next.
After reading and agreeing to the terms of the End User License Agreement, click I accept the terms of this license agreement and click Next.

In the Select the installation path field, type the path where you want JBoss Developer Studio to be installed or click Browse to navigate to the desired location. When the Select the installation path field shows the correct path, click Next. When you are prompted about the specified location being created or overwritten, review the message and, if satisfied, click OK.

textobject.phrase: In the Select the installation path field, type the path where you want JBoss Developer Studio to be installed or click Browse to navigate to the desired location. When the Select the installation path field shows the correct path, click Next.

step.para: In the Select Java VM step, Default Java VM is automatically selected. Ensure that the disabled text field contains the path of the Java developer kit you want to use. This is based on the default Java developer kit of your system. To change the specified Java developer kit, click Specific Java VM and type the path of the Java developer kit in the text field or use the Browse button to locate the Java developer kit. When the text field shows the correct Java developer kit path, click Next.

textobject.phrase: In the Select Java VM step, Default Java VM is automatically selected. Ensure that the disabled text field contains the path of the Java developer kit you want to use. This is based on the default Java developer kit of your system. To change the specified Java developer kit, click Specific Java VM and type the path of the Java developer kit in the text field or use the Browse button to locate the Java developer kit. When the text field shows the correct Java developer kit path, click Next.

important.para:
You must specify a Java developer kit with a 32-bit JRE to install a 32-bit version of JBoss Developer Studio and a 64-bit JRE to install a 64-bit version of JBoss Developer Studio. To change the bit version of the Java developer kit to be used for installing JBoss Developer Studio, complete the appropriate step for your operating system:
On OS X operating systems, from the Installation type list click the appropriate bit version.
On Linux distributions and Microsoft Windows operating systems, in the text field type the path to the appropriate bit version of the Java developer kit.

step.para:
To make use of automatic runtime detection for finding application servers, click Add. In the Location field, type the path from which recursive scanning for application servers is to commence or click Browse to navigate to the location:
To detect a specific application server, select the install directory for that application server.
To detect multiple application servers, select a directory higher up the directory tree. Alternatively, this can be achieved by adding multiple locations for scanning.
To scan the specified path for new application servers each time JBoss Developer Studio starts, select the Scan every start check box. Click OK to close the Add Location window and click Next.

figure.title: Add Location Window for Runtime Detection

textobject.phrase: Type the path from which recursive scanning for application servers is to commence or click Browse to navigate to the path. For this path to be scanned for new application servers each time JBoss Developer Studio starts, select the Scan every start check box. Click OK to close the Add Location window.

step.para: Review the details in the Summary Information window and, if they are correct, click Next.
Installation commences. When the Pack installation progress bar shows Finished, click Next.

figure.title: Installation Step 7: Installation Progress in Finished State

textobject.phrase: When the Pack installation progress bar shows Finished, click Next.

step.para: To create shortcuts for starting JBoss Developer Studio, select the Create shortcuts in the Start-Menu and Create additional shortcut on the desktop check boxes and click Next.

The installation process is now complete. To automatically start JBoss Developer Studio when the Installer window closes, select the Run JBoss Developer Studio after installation check box. Click Done to close the Installer window.

important.para: Linux distributions have a maximum number of files that a process can have open at one time. If this maximum number of files is set too low, JBoss Developer Studio will not start. You must open the /etc/security/limits.conf file and ensure that the soft nofile and hard nofile variables have values of 9216 at a minimum. If the variables have smaller values, the values must be increased to 9216. If the variables are not specified, the following lines must be added to the file: * soft nofile 9216 * hard nofile 9216

section.title: Install JBoss Developer Studio BYOE
section.para: You can obtain JBoss Developer Studio BYOE from Eclipse Marketplace or use the .zip file available from the Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio Update website. The latter option provisions for online and offline installation modes; Eclipse can install directly from the online .zip file or you can download the .zip file first and then Eclipse can install from this local copy.
Select one of the procedures below, which will guide you through the JBoss Developer Studio BYOE installation process.

step.para: Start Eclipse Kepler.
Click Help→Eclipse Marketplace.
In the Find field of the Search tab, enter JBoss Developer Studio.
Locate Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio (Kepler) and click Install.

figure.title: Install JBoss Developer Studio BYOE via Eclipse Marketplace

textobject.phrase: Click Help→Eclipse Marketplace. In the Find field of the Search tab, enter JBoss Developer Studio. Locate Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio (Kepler) and click Install.

step.para: Ensure the Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio (Kepler) check box is selected and click Confirm >.

textobject.phrase: Ensure the Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio (Kepler) check box is selected and click Confirm >.

step.para: After reading and agreeing to the licenses, click I accept the terms of the license agreements and click Finish.

textobject.phrase: After reading and agreeing to the licenses, click I accept the terms of the license agreements and click Finish.

step.para: During the installation process you may receive warnings about installing unsigned content. If this is the case, review the details of the content and if satisfied click OK to continue with the installation.

figure.title: Warning Prompt for Installing Unsigned Content

textobject.phrase: During the installation process you may receive warnings about installing unsigned content. If this is the case, review the details of the content and if satisfied click OK to continue with the installation.

step.para: Once installing is complete, you are prompted to restart Eclipse. Click Yes to restart now and No if you need to save any unsaved changes to open projects. Note that IDE changes do not take effect until Eclipse is restarted.

note.para: To install JBoss Developer Studio BYOE in offline mode, you must go to and download the update .zip file before proceeding.

step.para: Start Eclipse Kepler.
Click Help→Install New Software.
Complete the appropriate step for your chosen install mode:
For online mode, in the Work with field enter https://devstudio.jboss.com/updates/7.0/.

textobject.phrase: For online mode, in the Work with field enter https://devstudio.jboss.com/updates/7.0/.

step.para: For offline mode, in the Work with field enter the path of the update .zip file. Alternatively, click Add and click Archive to locate the file.

figure.title: Work from a Local Copy of the Update .zip File

textobject.phrase: For offline mode, in the Work with field enter the absolute file path of the update .zip file.

step.para: From the table of components, select JBoss Developer Studio 7.0 - Bring Your Own Eclipse and click Next.

figure.title: Available Software Window Listing JBoss Developer Studio 7.0 - Bring Your Own Eclipse

textobject.phrase: From the table of components comprising the update .zip file, select JBoss Developer Studio 7.0 - Bring Your Own Eclipse and click Next.

step.para: Review the details of the component to be installed and click Next.
After reading and agreeing to the licenses, click I accept the terms of the license agreements and click Finish.
